text: These are the results of the boxing competition at the 1936 Summer Olympics in Berlin. Medals were awarded in eight weight classes. The competitions were held from 10 to 15 August. The competition featured prominently in the French film L'as des as (1982), whose main character, played by Jean-Paul Belmondo, was the fictitious coach of the French boxing team. ==Participating nations== A total of 179 boxers from 31 nations competed at the Berlin Games: {| class=wikitable |- | || || || || |- | || || || || |- | || || || || |- | || || || |- | || || || |- | || || || |- | || || || |} {| |} Boxing ==Medal summary== {| |-valign="top" | Flyweight (−50.8 kg / 112 lb) | | | |-valign="top" | Bantamweight (−53.5 kg / 118 lb) | | | |-valign="top" | Featherweight (−57.2 kg / 126 lb) | | | |-valign="top" | Lightweight (−61.2 kg / 135 lb) | | | |-valign="top" | Welterweight (−66.7 kg / 147 lb) | | | |-valign="top" | Middleweight (−72.6 kg / 160 lb) | | | |-valign="top" | Light heavyweight (−79.4 kg / 175 lb) | | | |-valign="top" | Heavyweight (over 79.4 kg/175 lb) | | | |} ==Medal table== ==References== ==External links== * International Olympic Committee medal database Category:1936 Summer Olympics events 1936 Category:1936 in boxing
title: Boxing at the 1936 Summer Olympics
